intro: Sloanea wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack's sloanea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse growth forms and ecological roles. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. Sloanea wurdackii produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
